content.webTitle: Alcohol protects against dementia, researchers say

fields.headline: Alcohol protects against dementia, researchers say
fields.bodyText: Alcohol cuts the risk of developing Alzheimer's disease, especially among women and non-smokers, and drinkers are at lower risk than teetotallers, according to researchers from Valencia University in Spain, writing in the Journal of Alzheimer's Disease. "Our results for alcohol consumption generally point to a protective effect, especially light and moderate drinkers." Men and women who have never smoked also help ward off the main form of dementia through the occasional tipple, the team adds. "The idea that alcohol might protect us from dementia is enticing, but we don't yet know this with certainty," said Rebecca Wood, chief executive of the Alzheimer's Research Trust.
